newsitem.title: USA: GT says Wal-Mart to test software purchases.
newsitem.headline: GT says Wal-Mart to test software purchases.

text.p: GT Interactive Software Corp, an entertainment software provider, said on Monday that it has reached an understanding that allows Wal-Mart Stores Inc to begin testing direct purchasing of software from three software publishers during the second half of 1997.
GT Interactive, however, will continue to manage the inventories and shelf space for over 120 software publishers whose products are sold in Wal-Mart, the company said.
Wal-Mart's direct purchases from three software makers would not materially affect GT's 1997 earnings, the company said.
GT Interactive said Wal-Mart will begin purchases from CUC International Inc, Electronic Arts Inc and LucasArts Entertainment.
Distribution to Wal-Mart of the titles of the three publishers accounted for about $20 million in 1996, GT Interactive said.
GT Interactive said it planned to gradually handle distribution for fewer third party vendors at Wal-Mart so it could focus on its higher margin software publishing business.
